text:
As per the discussion they are writing their own servelet from where they want to call IC render api with json data.
I don't think they want to configure prefill via fdm.
Can't it configured directly as prefill via FDM?
How is data pulled from there system and provided to Render Service API?
FDM support JSON schema actually its Json schema++ with operational details extra
+1 for FDM based approach.

There have been similar requests from other customers as well (LPL. KB) where customer doesnt want FDM to be created, rather directly use Json Schema while Authoring and Render PDF with corresponding data.json either for DoR generation or Output usecase.
Adding <@W6CBB4953> <@W4RU4N66R> <@U0213T59LMN> to guide on this flow and does FDM support Json schema is sufficient or we need to additional Json schema support

I guess that can be handled with FDM via custom prefill service. FDM provides a lot of goodness at its own level. Taking data directly as part of API will lead us to redo a lot of work which FDM already provides like schema validation, etc.

We need to educate the customer about this. The functionality they are asking is all there but there is a better mechanism to use it. We can have someone from FDM team on the call to explain this to the customer.
Just one task pending for this use case. We need to update `IC render API` to accept `json data` as well.
This will not require any additional work at our end and solve customer’s problem.

Details on Current Proposal Workflow:
• The user creates a `FDM data source` using a Swagger file that defines the JSON schema.
• This data source is used to configure FDM, which generates entities based on the schema.
• The user then provides a `data.json` file that aligns with the FDM schema.
• Similar to how `dorService` works—accepting JSON, converting it to XML, and sending it to the output service—the `IC Render Service` will:
    ◦ Accept JSON input
    ◦ Convert it to XML
    ◦ Forward it to the output service
ok, there may be some restrictions with JSON schema. So, perhaps a spec review of this - if we are exposing JSON input directly.

I have clarified the requirements with NFCU regarding their intended use of JSON schema. They have confirmed that their use case specifically involves utilizing their own JSON schema for data binding.
While I discussed the possibility of leveraging the Render API with FDM—without relying on external JSON data—they emphasized the need to pass JSON data aligned with their custom schema. To accommodate this, I proposed an alternative approach: using FDM without a data source. So there is no need to support separate json schema.
IMO, we should ask them to use FDM rather than adding support to upload a json data file in the API since FDM has several other features like schema validation for these cases.

Hi Salil,

IMO We can support JSON data as input.

We are already using render API to generate pdf. The working of render API is as follows-
• It fetches the data json from FDM data source and transform that to data.xml.
So IMO That should work by using render API with additional data.json.
<@U038XFD63GS> for render API’s OSGI APIs.

Thanks Vijay.
Whats your thought on use of JSON data ?

> Currently, purging is not enabled by default, but this will change in the future.
> 
> Environments that were created after the default purging is enabled will have the following default values:
>      Replication, DAM, and page audit logs older than 7 days are removed.
>       *All possible events are logged.*
> 
> Environments that were created before the default purging is enabled will have the default values listed below, however it is recommended to lower those values in order to optimize performance.
>       Replication, DAM, and page audit logs older than 7 years are removed.
>       *All possible events are logged.*

    ◦ upload the package on their higher instances and then publish the forms
    ◦

Thats the 3rd option.. even if we are able to create it soon, maintaining it would take time.. We should do if this is big opportunity or there is enough repeatability.
pdf to pptx via pdfg: hopefully exportPDF should work <https://developer.adobe.com/experience-manager/reference-materials/6-5/forms/javadocs/index.html?com/adobe/fd/output/api/OutputService.html>
<@W010NNJV7S8> and I were discussing about the DoComm POC done in hackthon for word/excel based doc authoring if we can expand to PPT based authoring with data in free flow excel.

I am thinking following for now: Authoring in PPT since these would be marketing team with design agency, convert in background to PDF, import into Designer and add placeholders for data, merge data when final doc requested and send PDF (or better PPTX if possible?) The challenge would be to avoid human error in adding the data annotation in template since it would map from excel data. WDYT?
How can we achieve PDF to PPTX? PDFg?
They want to get rid of entire thing including Seismic, need us for dynamic personalized doc gen.

Good use case, thanks for sharing in details.
Options:
1. Ask them to move to xdp and get rid of Siesmic and use pdf for download which is better perhaps.. If they want the users to change the content, then pdf to pptx.
2. Are they also trying to get rid of Seismic. If not, they can use us for form filling and let doc generation be in Seismic - assuming its Seismic which takes care of this.
3. Support pptx template and data merge - so, expand our doc generation capabilities to pptx. We perhaps can explore if this is a big oppo.. but looking at volumes, it doesnt look like a big oppo for us.
Recording not available so shared screenshots for reference
Translations are done with original PPT template manually by 3rd party agency. Siesmic does the data merge and assembly only.
Chinese doc served by Siesmic platform
Language specific versions can be requested after generating english doc
Request form for internal users
Internal sharepoint site for internal users
Excel data
PPT template with placeholders
Can be viewed, shared but not edited. Served by Siesmic platform directly, not stored in SFDC or customer's end.

Sample final presentation for your reference: <https://eng17e.seismic.com/i/U1RcYPLUSSIGNHXPUv6W17uIaaGdt1S8npvn2PLUSSIGNPlospN8NisiEea7EbO4PKc04AriC9PLUSSIGNtKypV5WIhtPLUSSIGNacDRF___LNUUd2l297UfYkKH8aoyAcJMUiceNk9sM3x___PLUSSIGNC___PLUSSIGNVocd0EHmQC|https://eng17e.seismic.com/i/U1RcYPLUSSIGNHXPUv6W17uIaaGdt1S8npvn2PLUSSIGNPlospN8NisiE[…]7UfYkKH8aoyAcJMUiceNk9sM3x___PLUSSIGNC___PLUSSIGNVocd0EHmQC>

• The content is refreshed every 6 months related to their bi-annual fiscal reports
• Currently produced in house in a powerpoint format; much of it is manually created, but financial numbers are API'd in via Seismic ('Live Docs') – (they upload a table of all the financials by region)
• They don’t want this to be available on a microsite because they want people to actually have a copy of the document sent to them; their sales team also use this to send to key accounts so it’s used both internally & externally
Form: <https://www.macquarie.com/au/en/about/discover.html>

<@W4XTCQ07J> updated the doc, please check at <https://experienceleague.corp.adobe.com/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/forms/setup-configure-migrate/enable-adaptive-forms-core-components.html|https://experienceleague.corp.adobe.com/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/forms/[…]re-migrate/enable-adaptive-forms-core-components.html>

<@W4XTCQ07J>, Our documentation already mentions the below considerations:

*Considerations*
• When you create a fresh AEM Forms as a Cloud Service program, <https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/forms/setup-configure-migrate/enable-adaptive-forms-core-components#are-adaptive-forms-core-components-enabled-for-my-environment|Adaptive Forms Core Components and Headless Adaptive Forms are already enabled for your environment>.
• If your existing Cloud Service environment provides option to <https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/forms/adaptive-forms-authoring/authoring-adaptive-forms-core-components/create-an-adaptive-form-on-forms-cs/creating-adaptive-form-core-components|create Core Components-based Adaptive Forms>, Adaptive Forms Core Components and Headless Adaptive Forms are already enabled for your environment and you can serve Core Component based Adaptive Forms as headless forms to channels such as mobile, web, native apps, and services that require a headless representation of Adaptive Forms.
• If you have an older Forms as a Cloud Service program where Core Components are <https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/forms/setup-configure-migrate/enable-adaptive-forms-core-components#enable-components|not enabled>, you can <https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/experience-manager-cloud-service/content/forms/setup-configure-migrate/enable-adaptive-forms-core-components#enable-headless-adaptive-forms-for-an-aem-forms-as-a-cloud-service-environment|add Adaptive Forms Core Components dependencies> to your AEM as a Cloud Service repository and deploy the repository to your Cloud Service environments to enable Headless Adaptive Forms.

As discussed, we will add more robust checks around how to find if core components are enabled.

cc: <@W4R5WN6LR>

<@W9QMZFR39> We discussed this yesterday and aligned on supporting JSON in the Output Service.

Key points:
• Customers use a mix of XDP and Adaptive Forms.
• For Adaptive Forms and IC, JSON has already been adopted as the input format:
    ◦ Driven by technical considerations and simplification.
    ◦ Aligned with the direction customers are moving toward.
• Output Service is currently the only one that does not support JSON. Other services such as: *DoR API, Submission API and Rendition API* already support JSON input.
• *Low effort path*: DoR API, which already wraps the Output Service and supports JSON (but Adaptive Forms is required), can be transformed into a utility and reused across scenarios to enable JSON support more broadly.

> They are asking for *JSON input support for the Output API*. I believe a VIP was initiated for this feature have we made any decision on it yet?
<@W4RU4N66R>, no decision was made to support JSON in Output Service yet. Is this a hard requirement for them? Can you please share more details?

CC - <@W5HEU5M7Y>

Hi <@W4XTCQ07J>,
IIUC the requirement is to generate PDFs tailored to different locales. To achieve this, we can try the following approaches for authoring XDPs:
• *Option 1: Script-Based Localization (Single XDP)*
    ◦ *Approach*: Utilize locale-specific scripts within Designer to dynamically translate labels/captions.
    ◦ *Advantages*: Maintains a single XDP file, simplifying management.
    ◦ *Considerations*: This method may lead to a complex and heavy XDP structure, potentially impacting maintainability.
• *Option 2 (Recommended): Data Binding with Localized XML*
    ◦ *Approach*: Bind each label/caption to external data sources, similar to field value bindings. Prepare separate `data.xml` files for each locale, containing localized content.
    ◦ *Advantages*: Cleaner separation of contents, easier to manage and scale across multiple locales.
    ◦ *Implementation*: As a reference, we can create a sample XDP along with localized data and schema files to demonstrate this approach.
*Note:* we can discuss these approaches in details.

I checked with them - they would even be happy if the XFA is translated - and has formatting issues - as it would provide them with something better to start with (could we create a custom Translation workflow - in Project mode to handle this)?

Checked with them if they have plans to move to cloud - they mentioned about a security compliance which is blocking them - <@W4R4S9FS4> Mahomed (TAM) mentioned that you are aware of the same. Could you share more insights.
